text: Thank you <@U22PKFRU5> Currently I am using free version of HubSpot
Hi everyone, I am new, nice to meet you all!

I am new to HubSpot, I am trying to add an custom property into a ticket, please see the image below, is it possible to make the options in the property "Ticket Category" as nested list? That means there will be a sub category list for each current option.
Cool - I'm glad you're able to check it all out!

Hi <@UFGRJC6UV> - First off, welcome to the community! We're super excited to have you. :bmo:

Secondly - For your question... I'm not completely sure to be honest. I don't believe you can create nested custom categories..

I did dig up some help docs that outline how to create custom properties in tickets - you could review to see if they help get you the answer:

<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/contacts/how-can-i-create-a-custom-property>

<https://www.google.com/search?q=site%3AHubSpot.com+custom+property+into+a+ticket&oq=site%3AHubSpot.com+custom+property+into+a+ticket&aqs=chrome..69i57j69i58.4269j0j1&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8>

Also - You could ask in the community which specializes in tickets: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Tickets-Conversations/bd-p/service_conversations_tickets>

Lastly, if you have a paid HubSpot account - You could call into our customer support and chat with a rep. They can literally walk you through how to do it (if it's possible).

Hey All I am Jaspal, Junior Developer from Burlington, Canada. I would love to hear about workflow or process that professional developers generally use when building websites in HubSpot, well this is my first HubSpot project I am trying very hard to not ~fuck~ it up :grinning:.
Quick question: how did you get livereload working? I am sick of hitting shift+command+r...
Or is it possible to make one property dependent to another property in the tickets?
browsersync with proxy? browsersync is new to me but wanted to make sure I headed down the right path
Hi Luke! it's my 3rd day of visiting the HubSpot of my client. So far I'm still in the process of learning its structure... but most of the part, they are easy to learn.
My client has a requirement for a button that when clicked a popup form will show up.. is that possible? Upon checking CTA it does not provide an option for that at the meantimme
NVM figrued it out. Thanks for inspiring!
thanks! im still starting out tho, going thru the learning tools!
